com.msi.moble

Interface MotorolaApplicationCallback


  • public interface MotorolaApplicationCallback
    MoBLE stack callbacks for user application. Events of MoBLE stack are reported using these callbacks.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte STATUS_FAIL_ADDRESS
      Command is failed because it contains an illegal address.
      static byte STATUS_FAIL_COMMAND
      Command is failed because it contains an illegal opcode.
      static byte STATUS_FAIL_DEVICE
      Command is failed because destination device has failed its processing.
      static byte STATUS_FAIL_TIMEOUT
      Command is failed because response on the command was not received.
      static byte STATUS_FAIL_VALUE
      Command is failed because it contains an illegal data value.
      static byte STATUS_GATT_SENT
      Command is sent to GATT bridge.
      static byte STATUS_SUCCESS
      Command is succeeded.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void inRange(boolean prevStatus, boolean newStatus)
      Called if smart phone is in range of not.-Will be removed in Future
      void modelCallback(ApplicationParameters.Address src, ApplicationParameters.Address dst)
      Called in case of Generic Model Command(GenericON/OFF) is Published from the Node
      void onBufferLoadChanged(int count)
      Called if amount of packet to be transmitted is changed.
      void onDeviceAppeared(java.lang.String bt_addr)
      Called if detected unconfigured MOBLE device.
      void onDeviceRssiChanged(java.lang.String bt_addr, int mRssi)
      Called if device's RSSI value changed.
      void onDongleStateChanged(boolean enabled)
      Called if local Bluetooth chip has changed its state.
      void onError(java.lang.String text)
      Called if MoBLE stack is encountered the error.
      void onProxyConnectionEvent(boolean process, java.lang.String proxyAddress)
      Called when connected to proxy Node.
      void onResponse(mobleAddress peer, java.lang.Object cookies, byte status, byte[] data)
      called on Reliable response from the Node.If The value is set to true for Reliable/unreliable parameter in Any Vendor Command(SetRemotedata)
      void onUpdateRemoteData(mobleAddress peer, java.lang.Object cookies, short offset, byte count, byte[] data)
      Called during Asynchronous Message being Sent from the Node.Deprecated, equivalent to onWriteLocalData
      void onWriteLocalData(mobleAddress peer, mobleAddress dst, java.lang.Object cookies, short offset, byte count, byte[] data)
      Called in case of Vendor Model Command is Published from the Node

    • Field Detail

      • STATUS_SUCCESS

        static final byte STATUS_SUCCESS
        Command is succeeded.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_FAIL_COMMAND

        static final byte STATUS_FAIL_COMMAND
        Command is failed because it contains an illegal opcode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_FAIL_ADDRESS

        static final byte STATUS_FAIL_ADDRESS
        Command is failed because it contains an illegal address.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_FAIL_VALUE

        static final byte STATUS_FAIL_VALUE
        Command is failed because it contains an illegal data value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_FAIL_DEVICE

        static final byte STATUS_FAIL_DEVICE
        Command is failed because destination device has failed its processing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_FAIL_TIMEOUT

        static final byte STATUS_FAIL_TIMEOUT
        Command is failed because response on the command was not received. This status code never returned. It is added to the list because it is generated by application if response is not received.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATUS_GATT_SENT

        static final byte STATUS_GATT_SENT
        Command is sent to GATT bridge. This status code is returned when command with requested response is passed to GATT bridge. It is expected that application can start waiting after that moment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • onWriteLocalData

        void onWriteLocalData(mobleAddress peer,
                      mobleAddress dst,
                      java.lang.Object cookies,
                      short offset,
                      byte count,
                      byte[] data)
        Called in case of Vendor Model Command is Published from the Node
        Parameters:
        peer - Source Address of the Node.
        dst - Target Address of the Node or Group to which Vendor Message is Published
        cookies - if null then response is not required. :Deprecated
        offset - Target Address of the Node or Group to which Generic Message is Published
        count - : deprecated
        data - data Published in the Vendor Command Message

      • onUpdateRemoteData

        void onUpdateRemoteData(mobleAddress peer,
                        java.lang.Object cookies,
                        short offset,
                        byte count,
                        byte[] data)
        Called during Asynchronous Message being Sent from the Node.Deprecated, equivalent to onWriteLocalData
        Parameters:
        peer - address of device which has sent the command.
        offset - starting address of data range in address space.
        count - : deprecated
        data - data buffer.

      • onResponse

        void onResponse(mobleAddress peer,
                java.lang.Object cookies,
                byte status,
                byte[] data)
        called on Reliable response from the Node.If The value is set to true for Reliable/unreliable parameter in Any Vendor Command(SetRemotedata)
        Parameters:
        peer - address of device which has sent the command.
        cookies - if null then response is not required. :Deprecated
        status - status of the command. One of the following constants is expected:
        STATUS_SUCCESS,
        STATUS_FAIL_ADDRESS,
        STATUS_FAIL_COMMAND,
        STATUS_FAIL_DEVICE,
        STATUS_FAIL_VALUE,
        STATUS_GATT_SENT.
        data - data buffer appended to response.

      • onDongleStateChanged

        void onDongleStateChanged(boolean enabled)
        Called if local Bluetooth chip has changed its state.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if Bluetooth chip is enabled, false otherwise.

      • onBufferLoadChanged

        void onBufferLoadChanged(int count)
        Called if amount of packet to be transmitted is changed.
        Parameters:
        count - amount of packets.

      • onProxyConnectionEvent

        void onProxyConnectionEvent(boolean process,
                            java.lang.String proxyAddress)
        Called when connected to proxy Node. Do not perform any transactions when proxy connection procedure is in progress.
        Parameters:
        process - true if connection in process, false if connection procedure is not active.
        proxyAddress - Address of proxy.

      • onDeviceAppeared

        void onDeviceAppeared(java.lang.String bt_addr)
        Called if detected unconfigured MOBLE device.
        Parameters:
        bt_addr - bluetooth address.

      • onError

        void onError(java.lang.String text)
        Called if MoBLE stack is encountered the error.
        Parameters:
        text - string with error description.

      • onDeviceRssiChanged

        void onDeviceRssiChanged(java.lang.String bt_addr,
                         int mRssi)
        Called if device's RSSI value changed.
        Parameters:
        bt_addr - bluetooth address.
        mRssi - RSSI value.

      • inRange

        void inRange(boolean prevStatus,
             boolean newStatus)
        Called if smart phone is in range of not.-Will be removed in Future
        Parameters:
        prevStatus - previous status of network.
        newStatus - new status of network.

      • modelCallback

        void modelCallback(ApplicationParameters.Address src,
                   ApplicationParameters.Address dst)
        Called in case of Generic Model Command(GenericON/OFF) is Published from the Node
        Parameters:
        src - Source Address of the Node.
        dst - Target Address of the Node or Group to which Generic Message is Published
